meanings.definition: The quality or state of being ghostly.
meanings.sent1: The ghostliness of the abandoned house sent shivers down my spine.
meanings.sent2: The ghostliness of the graveyard at night made me feel uneasy.
meanings.sent3: The ghostliness of the Halloween decorations made the party feel spooky.
meanings.sent4: The ghostliness of the fog enveloped the town in an otherworldly aura.
meanings.sent5: The ghostliness of the old painting seemed to follow me wherever I went.

meanings.definition: The appearance or feeling of being haunted by ghosts.
meanings.sent1: She couldn't shake off the ghostliness that lingered in the old mansion.
meanings.sent2: The ghostliness of the attic made her hair stand on end.
meanings.sent3: The ghostliness of the mirror made her wonder if it was really haunted.
meanings.sent4: The ghostliness of the whispers in the dark hallway made her heart race.
meanings.sent5: The ghostliness of the creaking floorboards made her fear the unseen.

meanings.definition: The eerie or supernatural atmosphere associated with ghosts.
meanings.sent1: The ghostliness of the misty forest gave it an ethereal quality.
meanings.sent2: The ghostliness of the abandoned asylum made it a popular ghost-hunting spot.
meanings.sent3: The ghostliness of the full moon added to the mystery of the night.
meanings.sent4: The ghostliness of the howling wind created a chilling effect.
meanings.sent5: The ghostliness of the old castle made it feel like a scene from a horror movie.
